timeline.bodyText: In the travis build, there's a part where we try not to cache ~/.m2/repository/org/eclipse/collections. Do we need to do something similar here?
timeline.author: motlin
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,38 @@
+# This workflow will build a Java project with Maven
+# For more information see: https://help.github.com/actions/language-and-framework-guides/building-and-testing-java-with-maven
+
+name: Eclipse Collections - Acceptance Tests
+
+on: [push, pull_request]
+
+jobs:
+  applications:
+    name: Acceptance Tests ${{ matrix.java-version }}
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest]
+        java-version: [8]
+
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+
+    steps:
+      - name: Git Checkout
+        uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set Maven Wrapper
+        run: mvn -N io.takari:maven:0.7.7:wrapper -Dmaven=3.6.1
+      - name: Set JDK ${{ matrix.java-version }}
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: ${{ matrix.java-version }}
+      - name: Enable Maven Cache
+        uses: actions/cache@v1
+        with:
+          path: ~/.m2/repository
